DOC.brief_summary: Non-Hodgin's lymphoma is curable in 76% of patients. In nonlymphoblastic lymphmas, cancer may return on average 3 months from beginning treatment and for lymphoblastic lymphomas, 6 months. To aggressively treat this cancer this study uses effective drugs in three parts: - Induction ends on day 19 - Consolidation ends on day 38 or 42 - Maintenance may include up to 6 cycles
DOC.brief_title: LSA4 Protocol for the Treatment of Advanced Pediatric and Adolescent Non-Hodgkins Lymphoma
DOC.criteria: NonHodgkin's Lymphoma stages III, IV, IVA with 1. T cell lymphomas, any primary site irrespective of LDH level 2. large cell lymphomas, any primary site irrespective of LDH level 3. B cell lymphomas, any primary site with initial LDH of less than 500 B cell lymphomas, any primary site with initial LDH of less than 500 and initial CNS or bone involvement
